Comment: Based on her social media posts over the past few weeks, she was very very mentally unwell. She just lost custody of her kids, getting divorced, was just in a car accident where she (or the car she was in?) was hit by a bus.  She was publicly crashing out on social media and posted she only had three days to live after the car accident. Despair over the situation with her kids.  Survivors of sexual abuse have a higher risk of mental illnesses and suicide. Add her early traumas to the recent marriage and custody issues and car accident, along with the stress over trials. It's easy to see how she could have been overwhelmed with despair. That post about her kids was heartbreaking.  Eta: my details a bit off. From an article:  *Last month Virginia posted a photo, showing her lying on a hospital bed covered in bruises, along with her statement that she had "four days to live" caused the same amount of shock. Police said there had been only a "minor crash" with no reports of serious injuries, while sources close to Virginia said her post had been a "mistake".  The sex abuse survivor reportedly recently split from her husband of two decades, Robert Giuffre, and became estranged from their three teenage children - two sons and a daughter. Until recently, the family had been living an idyllic and quiet life in a ¬£1 million seaside six-bedroomed home in Ocean Reef, Perth.*
